description: A chalky-white powder that when mixed with a saline solution can be injected for emergency medical use due to its ability to efficiently deliver oxygen throughout the body.  While synthetic blood is unperishable in its powder form, once injected, it is highly unstable as its molecules decay and over the course of several hours the body purges it from the bloodstream.
